doc:
Peggy George https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peggy_George 0 Peggy George (1908 – 1978) was an American film actress from the silent movie era. Born Margaret George de Mille, she was the daughter of William C. de Mille; her older sister was choreographer Agnes de Mille. (William was the nephew of noted film director Cecil B. DeMille.) George married producer B. P. Fineman on September 10, 1930. The couple had one daughter, named Judith; and divorced in 1937. Subsequently, she was married to one Richard Miller. She died in 1978. As a member of the DeMille family of presumed interest to the tabloids, Peggy George is name-dropped in the 1931 film Five Star Final. Peggy_George ( 1908 – 1978 ) was an_American_film_actress from the_silent_movie_era . Born Margaret_George_de_Mille , she was the_daughter of William_C._de_Mille ; her_older_sister was choreographer Agnes de Mille . (_William was the_nephew of noted_film_director_Cecil_B._DeMille . ) George married producer_B._P._Fineman on September_10_,_1930 . The_couple had one_daughter , named Judith ; and divorced in 1937 . Subsequently , she was married to one_Richard_Miller . She died in 1978 . As a_member of the_DeMille_family of presumed_interest to the_tabloids , Peggy_George is_name-dropped in the_1931_film_Five_Star_Final .
